content.question: Out of a total of <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></math> students at a school, the number of students who have seen a new television program increases at a rate proportional to the product of the number of students who have seen the program and the number of students who have not seen the program. If <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></math> denotes the number of students who have seen the program at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following differential equations could be used to model this situation, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math> is a positive constant?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of S, with respect to t, equals, k S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of S, with respect to t, equals, k t, times, open parenthesis, N minus t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>t</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of S, with respect to t, equals, k S, times, open parenthesis, N minus S, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>S</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>S</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of S, with respect to t, equals, k S, times, open parenthesis, S minus N, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>S</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of S, with respect to t, equals, k S, times, open parenthesis, N minus S, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>S</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>S</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
